Deficiency Narrative: Two bathrooms were observed, and one had a clogged sink and the other a broken toilet handle.
During the inspection, multiple gnats were observed around the facility.
Multiple children in care and staff stated that personal phone calls are taken as a consequence.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from the Administrator on 3/11/25 stated that when the clients' behaviors escalate due to the phone calls, and it is in the best interest of the client to have them not make a call to give them time to stabilize and have additional therapy before the next call. 

When a consequence is given to any kid we meet with them, discuss the behavior that led to the consequence, and they sign acknowledging the information is accurate. 

The children have 3 days a week for personal calls (Sunday, Tuesday and Thursday) and even if/when personal call restriction is used as a consequence it is noted for 1 day unless a different agreement is made with the caseworker's approval. So, they still have a minimum of 2 additional times each week to contact their approved family and friends as we support and promote positive communication for them as well. 

The administrator attached a blank document that is used to make the child aware of their consequences and the circumstances surrounding the consequences.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, one out of 4 children's service plans reviewed was completed past the 45-day requirement.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection at the operation, the administrator stated she will be responsible for double checking with her case manager regarding required document timeframes moving forward to ensure they are being completed timely.

Deficiency Narrative: Four out of four employee files reviewed had Affidavit for Employment forms that were not notarized.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included the originally incomplete affidavits completed and notarized.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of four child files reviewed did not contain required documentation is the files within 30 days.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator that included the missing documents from the children files.

Deficiency Narrative: Four out of four employee files reviewed did not contain documentation of reference checks and employment history checks completed.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator which included the missing employee reference checks for verification.

Deficiency Narrative: The name and signature of the person who administered the medication were missing. Photos of the missing staff signature were taken. The staff names and signatures of those who administered the medication log were updated to correct the deficiency.
The unauthorized absence log report did not have the age of the child, date of admission, gender of child, and the staff that was present during the unauthorized absence.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator that included a copy of the updated unauthorized absence log to include the missing details as added columns on the form.

Deficiency Narrative: Two incident reports indicate a restraint occurred but does not have the length of time.  Two incident reports did not include the de-escalation attempts before or during the restraint. Two incident reports do not indicate that staff attempted to explain to the child what was required to be released from the hold.
Correction Narrative: The operation conducted a training on February 21, 2024, regarding proper documentation and appropriate times to administer an EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on two incident reports, it was determined that staff used EBI to get the child to comply with getting back downstairs and to get back on task at school.
Correction Narrative: The operation conducted a training on February 21, 2024, regarding proper documentation and appropriate times to administer an EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: A youth in care obtained bruising by being pushed to the ground by a caregiver.
This standard was found deficient as part of a DFPS investigation.
Two out of three employees did not have an affidavit for employment completed in their files reviewed.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a copy of the missing affidavits signed and notarized.

Deficiency Narrative: It's suggested a designee is assigned to audit all medication immediately upon receiving from the pharmacy to ensure all medication labels are correct before administering. If a medication label has an error, the pharmacy should be notified immediately to have it corrected. This will ensure the youth in care is being administered medication per a health professional's orders.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a copy of the email correspondence between operational staff and their pharmacy in regards to issues with receiving packaged medications that are incorrect count or not completely sealed upon receiving.

Deficiency Narrative: One of three child files reviewed did not have a completed initial service plan.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent from the operation's owner, Synithia Harvey, that included a copy of the missing initial service plan.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three employee files reviewed did not contain a job description.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a copy of the missing job descriptions signed.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the preponderance of evidence in this investigation, staff used inappropriate discipline towards a child in care which results in a deficiency of 748.2307(1)
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted re-training records and suspended the staff one week as a result of this investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff intimidated children in care using profane language in order to increase personal space.  Staff baited a child to strike them so law enforcement could be called.
Correction Narrative:
The operation reported conducting a recent training to address that addressed the minimum standard violation identified in this case. 
On 12/13/2023 from 6PM to 745PM Trauma Informed Discipline training was conducted. The trainer discussed subchapter M Discipline and Punishment. Specifically, the training addressed prohibited punishment. A sign in sheet was provided to RCC identifying 18 unique signatures. Two of the signatures belong to the two staff identified in this investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the medication room the medication cabinet was observed to be unlocked. Two children's medication boxes were observed to have Scheduled II substances in them.
Several documents reviewed were not completely filled in with dates and signatures missing.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a CAP detailing how the operation is changing their organization of active binders and who's responsible for ensuring their accuracy. It also indicated a routine audit will be implemented to ensure this is being completed correctly.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of three child files reviewed included a service plan that was signed by someone other than the Treatment Director or PLSP.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's owner that included a CAP detailing how the operation is changing their organization of active binders and who's responsible for ensuring their accuracy. It also indicated a routine audit will be implemented to ensure this is being completed correctly.
